item.content:encoded:
Fire safety inspections

New York City

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
NY Fire Consultants, Inc.

165 McBaine Avenue

Staten Island, NY 10309

(718) 432-1600    (718) 967-8195 fax

www.nyfiresafe.com

www.nyfsi.com

FIRE AND LIFE SAFETY INSPECTION

{address}
{city}, {state} {zip_code}

On {date_of_inspection}, NY Fire Consultants at the above premises conducted a Fire and Life Safety Inspection. The areas inspected are listed below. If any unsafe conditions or violations were found it would be listed below each area of inspection.

The building address was not easily discernible from the street. In the event of an emergency, this could result in a delay for the First Responders (Fire Department, Police Department, Emergency Medical Services, etc.) Address numbers: Buildings and structures shall have their lawful address numbers, building numbers and/or other approved building identification placed at a location on or near a building that allows such building identification to be plainly discernible from the public street or frontage space. These numbers shall contrast with their background.
An accumulation of rubbish was found in the following areas: {indicate_exterior_areas_where_rubbish_was_found}
An exterior survey of the building was conducted and the following structural defect/s were noticed: {describe_any_visible_exterior_structural_defects}

An exterior survey of the building was conducted and exterior exit/s were found to be obstructed. Exits must be unobstructed at all times and any doors or gates along the exit path to the street must be unlocked or equipped with panic hardware.
The caps to the Fire Department Standpipe connection (Standpipe Siamese) were not painted red.

The Fire Department Standpipe connection (Standpipe Siamese) needs to be serviceable. Make certain that all threads are free of dirt and paint. Lubricate all swivels and make certain that clapper valves operate freely.
A sign indicating that the Fire Department Standpipe connection (Standpipe Siamese) is for the standpipe system was not present.

The Fire Department Sprinkler connection (Sprinkler Siamese) needs to be serviceable. Make certain that all threads are free of dirt and paint. Lubricate all swivels and make certain that clapper valves operate freely.

An exterior survey of the building was conducted and an Fire Department Sprinkler connection (Sprinkler Siamese) was found to be obstructed. Fire Code 508.5.4: Posts, fences, vegetation, rubbish containers, vehicles and other items shall not be installed, planted, placed, parked or stored near fire hydrants, fire department inlet connections or fire protection system control valves in a manner that would obscure the location of such fire hydrants, connections or valves, or that would hinder immediate access thereto by firefighting personnel.
The caps to the Fire Department Sprinkler connection (Sprinkler Siamese) were not painted green.
The caps to the Fire Department Combination connection (Siamese Connection) were not painted yellow.

The Fire Department Combination connection (Combination Siamese) needs to be serviceable. Make certain that all threads are free of dirt and paint. Lubricate all swivels and make certain that clapper valves operate freely.
A sign indicating that the Fire Department Combination connection (Combination Siamese) is for the Combination system was not present.

An exterior survey of the building was conducted and an Fire Department Combination connection (Combination Siamese) was found to be obstructed. Fire Code 508.5.4 : Posts, fences, vegetation, rubbish containers, vehicles and other items shall not be installed, planted, placed, parked or stored near fire hydrants, fire department inlet connections or fire protection system control valves in a manner that would obscure the location of such fire hydrants, connections or valves, or that would hinder immediate access thereto by firefighting personnel.

An exterior survey of the building was conducted and an Fire Department Standpipe connection (Standpipe Siamese) was found to be obstructed. Fire Code 508.5.4: Posts, fences, vegetation, rubbish containers, vehicles and other items shall not be installed, planted, placed, parked or stored near fire hydrants, fire department inlet connections or fire protection system control valves in a manner that would obscure the location of such fire hydrants, connections or valves, or that would hinder immediate access thereto by firefighting personnel.
A sign indicating that the Fire Department Sprinkler connection (Sprinkler Siamese) is for the Sprinkler system was not present.
This building does not have elevators.

The Service elevator sign was missing. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also indicate the elevator bank letter.

The Service elevator sign was missing. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also have a diagram showing where you are in relationship to the stairwells and indicate the elevator bank letter.

The Service elevator sign did not indicate the elevator bank letter. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also indicate the elevator bank letter.

The Service elevator sign did not indicate the elevator bank letter. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also indicate the elevator bank letter.

The Service elevator sign did not have a diagram showing where you are in relationship to the stairwells and did not indicate the elevator bank letter. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also have a diagram showing where you are in relationship to the stairwells and indicate the elevator bank letter.

The Service elevator sign did not indicate the elevator bank letter. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also have a diagram showing where you are in relationship to the stairwells and indicate the elevator bank letter.</output>

The Service elevator sign did not have a diagram showing where you are in relationship to the stairwells. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also have a diagram showing where you are in relationship to the stairwells and indicate the elevator bank letter.
The required No Smoking sign was not posted in or near the service elevator.

The Passenger elevator sign was missing. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also indicate the elevator bank letter.

The Passenger elevator sign was missing. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also have a diagram showing where you are in relationship to the stairwells and indicate the elevator bank letter.

The Passenger elevator sign did not indicate the elevator bank letter. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also indicate the elevator bank letter.

The Passenger elevator sign did not indicate the elevator bank letter. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also indicate the elevator bank letter.

The Passenger elevator sign did not have a diagram showing where you are in relationship to the stairwells and did not indicate the elevator bank letter. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also have a diagram showing where you are in relationship to the stairwells and indicate the elevator bank letter.

The Passenger elevator sign did not indicate the elevator bank letter. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also have a diagram showing where you are in relationship to the stairwells and indicate the elevator bank letter.

The Passenger elevator sign did not have a diagram showing where you are in relationship to the stairwells. On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall also have a diagram showing where you are in relationship to the stairwells and indicate the elevator bank letter.
The required No Smoking sign was not posted in or near the passenger elevator.

During this inspection, the apartment entrance doors are routinely not available, because these apartments are typically unoccupied. The self-closing entrance doors to the building's apartments were not checked. For the proper way to check self-closing doors see the NFPA Standard 80 Inspection Requirements located near the end of the report.

During this inspection, the apartment entrance doors are routinely not available, because these apartments are typically unoccupied. The self-closing entrance doors to the building's apartments were not checked. For the proper way to check self-closing doors see the NFPA Standard 80 Inspection Requirements located near the end of the report.

Storage was found in the following stairways or hallways: {describe_what_floors_stairway_letters_or_which_hallways_where_there_is_storage} Fire Code 1027.2: It shall be unlawful to obstruct or impede access to any required means of egress, including any exit, exit access or exit discharge. The New York City Fire Department is strenuously enforcing the law that forbids storage of any garbage, garbage receptacles, newspapers, cardboard boxes or any other items including furniture in stairways and on stairway landings. The New York City Fire Department is issuing violation orders and summons for non- compliance of this order. It is a dangerous practice to allow accumulations of anything in stairways. It is not only dangerous to firefighters, it is dangerous for employees and residents and their families and guests as well. In the past, tenants would bring the refuse to the basement for disposal by the building staff. If that is not feasible, building management will have to schedule frequent pick-ups of all items found in stairways or landings. This is an inconvenience to all but it is the law and it must be complied with. The fines are steep and the inspectors are enforcing this and other Fire Department laws very strenuously.
Repairs and/or adjustments need to be made to the door's self-closing device in the following areas: {describe_what_floors_and_stairway_self-closing_doors_do_not_operate_on}.
The self-closing door that leads to the stairs is working properly.
Repairs and/or adjustments need to be made to the door latching hardware at the following stairway doors: {describe_what_floors_and_stairway_door_latches_do_not_operate}.

Stairway doors leading to public hallways require door knobs on the public hallway side of the door. Deficiencies were found in the following areas: {describe_what_floors_and_stairways_do_not_have_door_knobs_on_the_public_hallway_side}.

Stairway exit door Fire Emergency Markings were not present. Deficiencies were found in the following areas: {describe_what_floors_and_stairway_doors_do_not_have_fire_emergency_markings_on_the_public_hallway_side}. Each stairwell door shall be identified by an approved Fire Emergency sign or marking on the door jamb of the public corridor side of the door. Such sign or marking must be not more than 12 inches from the bottom of the door. (See Apartment Identification, Directional Signs and Fire Emergency Markings attachment for additional information)

Stairway exit door Fire Emergency Markings were not present. Deficiencies were found in the following areas: {describe_what_floors_and_stairway_doors_do_not_have_fire_emergency_markings_on_the_public_hallway_side}. Each stairwell door shall be identified by an approved Fire Emergency sign or marking on the door jamb of the public corridor side of the door. Such sign or marking must be not more than 12 inches from the bottom of the door. (See Apartment Identification, Directional Signs and Fire Emergency Markings attachment for additional information)

Fire Emergency Markings on all apartments were not present. Deficiencies were found in the following areas: {indicate_those_apartments_where_emergency_markings_are_missing}. The entrance door to all dwelling units shall be identified on the doorjamb by an approved fire emergency marking, not more than 12 inches from the bottom of the door indicating the dwelling unit number and/or letter. If there are multiple entrances, every door of the dwelling unit that opens to a public corridor shall be identified. A star symbol shall identify the main entrance door and a triangle symbol shall identify a secondary entrance. (See Apartment Identification, Directional Signs and Fire Emergency Markings attachment for additional information)

Fire Emergency Markings on multi-floor apartments were not present. Deficiencies were found in the following areas: {list_multiple_floor_apartments_that_are_missing_emergency_markings} The entrance door to a multi-floor dwelling shall be identified on the door jamb by an approved fire emergency marking, not more than 12 inches from the bottom of the door indicating the dwelling unit number and/or letter. In addition, every door of the multi-floor dwelling that opens to a public corridor shall be identified by one or more upward or downward pointing arrows indicating the direction(s) of the other floor(s) to which the multi-floor dwelling is connected. A star symbol identifies the main entrance door. A triangle symbol identifies a secondary entrance. (See Fire Emergency Markings attachment for additional information)

An accumulation of rubbish was found in the in the following stairways or hallways: {describe_what_and_where_rubbish_is_found_in_the_hallways_and_stairs}. Fire Code 1027.2:. It shall be unlawful to obstruct or impede access to any required means of egress, including any exit, exit access or exit discharge. The New York City Fire Department is strenuously enforcing the law that forbids storage of any garbage, garbage receptacles, newspapers, cardboard boxes or any other items including furniture in stairways and on stairway landings. The New York City Fire Department is issuing violation orders and summons for non- compliance of this order. It is a dangerous practice to allow accumulations of anything in stairways. It is not only dangerous to firefighters, it is dangerous for employees and residents and their families and guests as well. In the past, tenants would bring the refuse to the basement for disposal by the building staff. If that is not feasible, building management will have to schedule frequent pick-ups of all items found in stairways or landings. This is an inconvenience to all but it is the law and it must be complied with. The fines are steep and the inspectors are enforcing this and other Fire Department laws very strenuously.
The scissor stairs were found to be incorrectly labeled. (see attached SCISSOR STAIR diagram for correct lettering of scissor stairs)

Stairways were not properly lettered. An alphabetic letter shall identify each stairway. The stair identification signs should be at least 3" high and shall be posted and maintained on both sides of the door leading to the stairway, on every floor, including the ground floor. If there is no door, the signs must be posted in a conspicuous place on the nearby wall or adjacent wall.

Floors were not properly numbered. The signs must be posted within each stair enclosure on every floor, including the street floor. It should be posted on the stairway side of the door, or if there is no door, the signs must be posted in a conspicuous place on the nearby wall or adjacent wall. The number shall be at least 3" high.

Apartment number/letter were missing. Each dwelling unit shall be identified on the public corridor side of the door by a room number and/or letter marking or sign conspicuously and durably printed or posted on or adjacent to at least 1 entrance door. (See Fire Emergency Markings attachment for additional information)

"Close the Door" Signs were missing. Close the Door notices were missing in the following areas: {indicate_those_floors_where_close_the_door_notice_signs_are_missing}. The Close the Door notice shall be posted and maintained on the public hallway corridor side of each stairwell door. The intent is to provide a clear, visible reminder to building residents of the importance of closing each door as one exits one's apartment and building during a fire. Closing these doors serves to contain the fire and smoke within the apartment, assist in firefighting operations and prevent smoke from entering the stairwells through which building residents may need to evacuate. (See Close the Door Notice attachment for additional information)

Public corridor directional signs were missing. Apartment buildings with more than 8 dwelling units on a floor, a sign shall be conspicuously posted in the elevator lobby on those floors identifying by directional arrows and dwelling unit numbers and/or letters, the direction of each unit. (See Fire Emergency Markings attachment for additional information)

The required "peephole" was not present in following apartment door/s: {indicate_those_apartments_where_required_peepholes_are_missing}. Housing Maintenance Code Sec. D26-20.01 Peepholes: In every dwelling the owner shall provide and maintain a peephole in the entrance door of each dwelling unit. Such peephole shall be located, as prescribed by the department, in such a place that the person in each dwelling unit may view from the inside any person immediately outside the entrance door. However, such peephole need not be installed in any tenant-occupied one- or two-family home where it is possible to see from the inside any person immediately outside the entrance door. This section shall not apply to hotels, apartment hotels, college or school dormitories, or owner-occupied dwelling units in one- and two-family homes.

Electrical outlets in the following public areas of the building did not have the required protective covers installed: {indicate_those_public_areas_where_protective_electrical_cover_are_not_installed}. Local Law 39 of 2015 states: Safety devices for certain electrical outlets required
  1. The owner of a multiple dwelling shall install and maintain protective caps, covers or other safety devices over electrical outlets in the public parts of such multiple dwelling, except that (1) such devices shall not be required in public parts used exclusively for mechanical equipment or storage purposes, and (2) such devices shall not be required for electrical outlets that are listed tamper-resistant receptacles in accordance with the New York city electrical code.
  2. An owner who fails to install or maintain protective caps, covers or other safety devices in accordance with this section shall be liable for a class A violation.
The metal screen under the glass skylight on top of the stairway bulkhead was missing.
Fire stopping was found to be missing or insufficient in the following areas: {indicate_those_areas_in_the_hallways_or_stairways_which_are_not_properly_fire_stopped}.
The emergency lighting battery back-up lights were tested and found to be operational. (see attached Emergency Lighting)

The emergency battery back-up lights were tested and found to be inoperable in the following areas: {indicate_which_emergency_battery_back-up_lights_are_inoperable} Check the batteries and if still inoperable, call an electrician to make necessary repairs. (see attached Emergency Lighting)

There were no records of the required inspection and testing of the Emergency Power Supply System (Emergency Generator) NFPA 110 Sec 8.4.1 requires that emergency power supply systems be inspected weekly and exercised under load monthly. Permanent records of inspection, tests, repair, etc. must be maintained and readily available.
The building does not keep records of the inspection for the Fire Emergency Markings on the apartments and the stairway exit door jambs.
The supports of the roof gravity tank were corroded and in need of painting . Scrape and remove the corrosion products and repaint it with two coats of paint of contrasting colors.
The roof tank was found to be in disrepair. The following deficiencies were noted: {describe_the_defects_found_to_the_roof_tank_ladders_and_walkways_etc}
Antenna wires, cable wires or those similar to it, were found hanging lower than 10 feet above the roof. Those obstructions must be raised to at least 10 feet above the roof.
The bulkhead door must be openable from the stairwell without the use of a key. An alarm and/or panic hardware is acceptable.
The roof brickwork/parapet was found to be in disrepair.
At the time of the inspection, the roof brickwork/parapet was under construction.
Unobstructed access to building rooftops for firefighting operations was not provided. (see attached FIRE CODE 504.4.1)

The Fire escapes are showing signs of rust. Plans should be made for painting and scraping of the fire escape. (see attached MULTIPLE DWELLING FIRE ESCAPE REQUIREMENTS) Housing Maintenance Code Sec. 27-2014 (b) states: The owner of a dwelling shall paint every fire escape with two coats of paint of contrasting colors. The owner shall paint the first coat before and the second after erection of a new fire escape, except that this shall not apply to fire escapes constructed of approved atmospheric corrosion resistant metal. Whenever a fire escape becomes corroded, the owner shall scrape and remove the corrosion products and repaint it with two coats of paint of contrasting colors.

Fire escape landings were found obstructed. Make certain that all fire escape balconies are passable and are not blocked by plants, air conditioners, rubbish etc. (see attached MULTIPLE DWELLING FIRE ESCAPE REQUIREMENTS)

The area below the fire escape drop ladder was found obstructed. Remove all obstructions that would interfere with the activation of the fire escape drop ladder or counterbalance stairway, or that would impede egress from the fire escape. (see attached MULTIPLE DWELLING FIRE ESCAPE REQUIREMENTS)
The fire escapes were found to have the following defects: {list_fire_escape_defects} (see attached MULTIPLE DWELLING FIRE ESCAPE REQUIREMENTS)

Part I -Building Information Section of the Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide was inaccurate. Post a correct Part I -Building Information Section of the Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide using the format required by the FDNY.

Part I -Building Information Section of the Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide and the Fire Safety Notice were not posted in a common area. Part I -Building Information Section of the Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide and the Fire Safety Notice shall be posted in a conspicuous area near any common mailbox area customarily used by the occupants of the building. If there is no common mailbox area, in a conspicuous location in or near the elevators or main stairwell.

The Fire Safety Notice was not posted in a common area. Part I -Building Information Section of the Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide and the Fire Safety Notice shall be posted in a conspicuous area near any common mailbox area customarily used by the occupants of the building. If there is no common mailbox area, in a conspicuous location in or near the elevators or main stairwell.

Part I -Building Information Section of the Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide was not posted in a common area. Part I -Building Information Section of the Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide and the Fire Safety Notice shall be posted in a conspicuous area near any common mailbox area customarily used by the occupants of the building. If there is no common mailbox area, in a conspicuous location in or near the elevators or main stairwell.

Part I -Building Information Section of the Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide and the Fire Safety Notice must be posted in a frame or under a clear plexiglas cover or laminated with a firm backing and designed to be affixed by mounting hardware or an adhesive, or printed on a matte-finish vinyl adhesive-backed decal not less than three (3) mils in thickness, using thermalprinting, screenprinting or other permanent, water-resistant printing technique.
The building does not keep records of a Fire Safety Notice being posted on the inside of apartment main entrance doors.

End of Fire and Life Safety Inspection Report

NY Fire Consultants, Inc.

165 McBaine Avenue

Staten Island, NY 10309

(718) 432-1600 (718) 967-8195 fax

www.nyfiresafe.com

www.nyfsi.com

FIRE AND LIFE SAFETY INSPECTION
{address}
{city}, {state} {zip_code}

If any unsafe conditions or violations were noted in the attached report, they should be addressed and corrected as soon as possible. Failure to correct these conditions may result in the issuance of a violation or summons during the next inspection

Also, please refer to the following enclosed attachments (if any were referenced in the report) for a more detailed explanation of the violations noted and any required forms.

{nyfc_examiner_signature}
Prepared by: {nyfc_examiner} {date_of_inspection}
Reviewed by: James T Bullock {date_of_inspection}
This building does not have a basement.
The self-closing fireproof door that leads to the basement is not working properly. The self-closing device needs to be repaired or replaced.
The self-closing fireproof door that leads to the basement is working properly.

Electrical wiring or electrical conduit in the cellar was found to be sub-standard and in need of repair.(E.G. open electrical boxes, exposed wires etc.) FC 605.6 Unapproved conditions. Open junction boxes and open-wiring splices shall be prohibited. Approved covers shall be provided for all switch and electrical outlet boxes.
Accumulation of flammable rubbish were found in the cellar.

Portable gasoline powered equipment was being improperly stored. The indoor storage of lawn-care equipment, power washers, snow blowers, portable generators and other portable fueled equipment designed for outdoor use shall be stored in a garage or garage space separated from dwelling spaces or other occupancies in accordance with the Building Code, or in a building classified as a Group U occupancy (Shed); or in another approved storage area in a building. (Fire Code Section 313)

Gasoline was being improperly stored. A permit is required if the total amount of gasoline stored is more than two and one half (2 1/2) gallons. The maximum capacity of any gasoline container is two and one half (2 1/2) gallons. The container must be made of metal and have a safety cap attached. The cap must be fitted with a spout designed to allow the gasoline to be poured without spilling. The contents of the container must be clearly marked on the side of the container. Gasoline can never be stored in glass or plastic containers.

Temporary electrical wiring (electrical extension cord) was found to be used in place of permanent wiring in the following areas: {indicate_those_areas_where_temporary_wiring_extension_cords_are_being_used_in_place_of_permanent_wiring} Fire Code 605.5 Extension cords: Extension cords and flexible cords shall not be a substitute for permanent wiring. Extension cords and flexible cords shall not be affixed to buildings or structures, extended through walls, ceilings or floors, or under doors or floor coverings, nor shall such cords be subject to environmental damage or physical impact. Extension cords shall be used only with portable devices.

An electrical circuit breaker panel manufactured by Federal Pacific Electrical was found in your building. Federal Pacific Electric Circuit Breaker Panels present a hazard. A Licensed Electrician should inspect the panel. (see Federal Pacific Electric Circuit Breaker Panels attachment for additional information)

There was no sign on the gas meter room door. The sign should read GAS METER ROOM - NO STORAGE PERMITTED. The lettering must be at least one inch high in bold type and properly spaced to provide good legibility. The lettering and background must be of contrasting colors. The sign must be permanently and conspicuously posted on the exterior of the meter room door.
The gas meter room was used for storage. Remove any stored material from the gas meter room.
The self-closing fireproof door that leads to the gas meter room is not working properly. The self-closing device needs to be repaired or replaced.
The self-closing fireproof door that leads to the gas meter room is working properly.

There was no sign on the electrical meter room door. The sign should read ELECTRICAL METER ROOM - USE NO WATER - NO STORAGE PERMITTED. The lettering must be at least one inch high in bold type and properly spaced to provide good legibility. The lettering and background must be of contrasting colors. The sign must be permanently and conspicuously posted on the exterior of the meter room door.
The electrical meter room was used for storage. Remove any stored material from the electrical meter room.
The self-closing fireproof door that leads to the Electrical Service Room is not working properly. The self-closing device needs to be repaired or replaced.
The self-closing fireproof door that leads to the Electrical Service Room is working properly.

Fire stopping was found to be missing or insufficient in the following areas: Basement: {indicate_those_areas_in_the_basement_which_are_not_properly_fire_stopped} All penetrations must be sealed to achieve original fire rating or better. FIRE-RESISTANCE-RATED CONSTRUCTION 703.1 Maintenance: The required fire-resistance rating of fire-resistance-rated construction (including walls, fire stops, shaft enclosures, partitions and floors) shall be maintained. Such elements shall be properly repaired, restored or replaced when damaged, altered, breached or penetrated. Openings made therein for the passage of pipes, electrical conduit, wires, ducts, air transfer openings, and holes made for any reason shall be protected with approved methods capable of resisting the passage of smoke and fire. Openings through fire-resistance-rated assemblies shall be protected by self-closing or automatic-closing doors of approved construction meeting the fire protection requirements for the assembly.
No boiler room. Heat supplied by outside steam.
No boiler room. Heat is provided by individual heating unit to each apartment.
Heat is provided individually in each apartment/unit
The remote control electrical shut off for the boiler was not labeled.

The fire extinguisher in the boiler room was missing or defective. A dry chemical type portable fire extinguisher with at least a 20-B:C rating, or a carbon dioxide type portable fire extinguisher with at least a 2-B:C rating shall be provided. Such portable fire extinguisher shall be located not more than 30 feet from the fuel oil fired equipment. A travel distance of up to 50 feet may be allowed if a dry chemical portable fire extinguisher with at least a 40-B:C rating, or a carbon dioxide portable fire extinguisher with at least a 4-B:C rating, is provided.
The boiler room fire-proof self closing door must be in good repair with the self closing mechanism operational.
The self-closing fireproof door that leads to the boiler room is working properly.
The boiler room fire-proof self closing door cannot be secured or chocked open.
The locked boiler room door didn't have a sign where the key is kept. If the door to the boiler room is locked there must be a sign on the door where the spare key is kept.
There was an accumulation of rubbish in the boiler room in the following area: {indicate_type_of_rubbish_and_location_in_the_boiler_room}
As a general fire safety precaution have a cleaning service or building service employees schedule the removal of lint from in and around clothes dryer and the dryer ducts at least twice a year.
The Laundry room fire-proof self closing door must be in good repair with the self closing mechanism operational.
The Laundry Room did not have a fireproof self-door. Best Practice would be to install a fireproof self-closing door.
The self-closing door that leads to the laundry room is working properly.

There was an excessive amount of lint in the ducts and behind the clothes dryers. This is a very serious fire hazard. Have a cleaning service schedule the removal of lint from in and around clothes dryer and the dryer ducts at least twice a year.
The required No Smoking sign was missing.

The laundry room was missing the required sprinklers. NYC Building code 27-954, sprinklers are required in drying area of laundries or similar spaces in which two or more clothes drying machines are installed. Sprinklers to be spaced to cover area five feet in front, rear, and sides of the drying machines.
This building does not have a Elevator Machinery Room.
Machine room doors shall be labeled ELEVATOR MACHINE ROOM with letters not less than two (2) inches high.
The self-closing fireproof door that leads to the elevator machinery room is not working properly. The self-closing device needs to be repaired or replaced.
The self-closing fireproof door that leads to the elevator machinery room is working properly.
The required ten-pound ABC extinguisher was not present. (Although a carbon dioxide extinguisher may be present, a 10 lb. ABC extinguisher is still required.)
The required covered metal container for the storage of oily rags was not present.
Elevator machinery oil was stored in the open in elevator machinery room. Elevator machinery oil can only be stored in the elevator machinery room if it is in a metal cabinet.
The self-closing door that leads to the Compactor Room is not working properly. The self-closing device needs to be repaired or replaced.
The Compactor Room did not have a fireproof self-door. Best Practice would be to install a fireproof self-door.
The self-closing door that leads to the Compactor Room is working properly.
The compactor's electrical shut off was not labeled. (see attached FIREPROOF MULTIPLE DWELLING COMPACTOR CHUTE REQUIREMENTS)

The O. S. and Y. shut off valve was not labeled. It is also <u>recommended</u> that if the shut-off valve is not located in the compactor room, an additional sign be placed inside the compactor room stating where the O. S. and Y. shut off valve is located. (see attached FIREPROOF MULTIPLE DWELLING COMPACTOR CHUTE REQUIREMENTS)
The O. S. and Y. shut off valve was not sealed open. (see attached FIREPROOF MULTIPLE DWELLING COMPACTOR CHUTE REQUIREMENTS)
The sprinkler head inside the compactor was covered with rubbish that will insulate the sprinkler head and delay operation. (see attached FIREPROOF MULTIPLE DWELLING COMPACTOR CHUTE REQUIREMENTS)
The required ten-pound ABC extinguisher was not present. (see attached FIREPROOF MULTIPLE DWELLING COMPACTOR CHUTE REQUIREMENTS)
The compactor room was missing the required six extra sprinkler heads. (see attached FIREPROOF MULTIPLE DWELLING COMPACTOR CHUTE REQUIREMENTS)
The required sketch of the system was not posted. (see attached FIREPROOF MULTIPLE DWELLING COMPACTOR CHUTE REQUIREMENTS)
The required garden hose outlet was not present. (see attached FIREPROOF MULTIPLE DWELLING COMPACTOR CHUTE REQUIREMENTS)
The required garden hose was not present. (see attached FIREPROOF MULTIPLE DWELLING COMPACTOR CHUTE REQUIREMENTS)
Rubbish chute doors are not fully closing properly: {list_the_rubbish_chute_room_doors_that_do_not_have_a_properly_operating_self-closing_door}

The form Certification of Compliance with Color Coding of Standpipe/Sprinkler Piping and Valve Handles was not available. The completed certificate should be notarized and kept at the building's fire command station. If the building does not have a fire command station, keep the certificate where other required building inspection and maintenance documents are kept. This space should be open Monday to Friday from 8AM - 5PM. (See attached Certification of Compliance with Color Coding of Standpipe/Sprinkler Piping and Valve Handles....., PAINTING REQUIREMENTS and EXAMPLES)

The sprinkler risers and cross connections were not painted red as required. (See attached Certification of Compliance with Color Coding of Standpipe/Sprinkler Piping and Valve Handles...., PAINTING REQUIREMENTS and EXAMPLES)

The sprinkler control valve handles were not painted green as required. (See attached Certification of Compliance with Color Coding of Standpipe/Sprinkler Piping and Valve Handles....., PAINTING REQUIREMENTS and EXAMPLES)

The combination control valve handles were not painted yellow as required. (See attached Certification of Compliance with Color Coding of Standpipe/Sprinkler Piping and Valve Handles....., PAINTING REQUIREMENTS and EXAMPLES)

Records of monthly inspections, testing and maintenance were not properly maintained. Monthly testing of the sprinkler system must be recorded in the sprinkler records log book which must be bound with the pages consecutively numbered.
An impairment coordinator is not designated in the logbook.
The required equipment (six extra sprinkler heads and wrench) were not present.
Sprinkler heads in the following area/s need to be kept unobstructed and free of paint or dirt: {indicate_the_location_of_any_sprinkler_heads_which_are_obstructed_with_paintdirt}
The signs on the sprinkler system control valves were not present.

A permanently mounted metal ladder must be provided to access any sprinkler control valves located 7 ft. above the floor. {indicate_the_location_of_any_sprinkler_valves_above_7_ft_without_a_ladder_being_provided}

There was no FP-100 record of the flow test required every 2-1/2 years. Residential sprinkler systems shall be flow tested annually, except such system may be flow tested once every 30 months, provided that the pressure gauge located at or near the inspector's test connection is checked during the required monthly inspection to make certain that the system design pressure is being maintained.

A bound logbook is required to keep records of inspection, maintenance, and testing of Sprinkler and Standpipe Systems. Logbooks have to be replaced every calendar year. An employee of the building is supposed to hold a S-12 and S-13 (Sprinkler and Standpipe) certificate.

The form Certification of Compliance with Color Coding of Standpipe/Sprinkler Piping and Valve Handles..... was not available. The completed certificate should be notarized and kept at the building's fire command station. If the building does not have a fire command station, keep the certificate where other required building inspection and maintenance documents are kept. This space should be open Monday to Friday from 8AM - 5PM. (See attached Certification of Compliance with Color Coding of Standpipe/Sprinkler Piping and Valve Handles....., PAINTING REQUIREMENTS and EXAMPLES)

The standpipe risers and cross connections were not painted red as required. (See attached Certification of Compliance with Color Coding of Standpipe/Sprinkler Piping and Valve Handles....., PAINTING REQUIREMENTS and EXAMPLES)

The standpipe handles were not painted red as required. (See attached Certification of Compliance with Color Coding of Standpipe/Sprinkler Piping and Valve Handles....., PAINTING REQUIREMENTS and EXAMPLES)
The standpipe valves were obstructed in the following areas: {indicate_which_standpipe_valves_are_obstructed}. Remove all rubbish or storage from the vicinity of the standpipe outlet valves

Records of monthly inspections, testing and maintenance were not properly maintained. Monthly testing of the standpipe system must be recorded in the standpipe records log book which must be bound with the pages consecutively numbered.
An impairment coordinator is not designated in the logbook.
The standpipe valves in the stairways do not appear to be operational.
Standpipe outlets were missing outlet caps and chains. Make certain all standpipe outlets are capped and have chains securing the cap to the outlet.
The standpipe outlet caps were not easily removable.

There was no sign near the first floor standpipe outlet stating where the fire hose cabinet is located. A metal sign shall be placed in each stair enclosure on the main entrance floor stating clearly where the storage cabinet is located. (see attached HOSE CABINET REQUIREMENTS)
The lock box with a key for the cabinet within it shall be marked "FIRE DEPARTMENT USE ONLY." This lock box is opened by a fire department key. (see attached HOSE CABINET REQUIREMENTS)

There was no sign on the cabinet stating where the spare key for the fire hose cabinet was stored. A sign shall be placed on the storage cabinet indicating the location of the spare key. (see attached HOSE CABINET REQUIREMENTS)
The hose cabinet key was either missing or could not open the hose cabinet lock. (see attached HOSE CABINET REQUIREMENTS)
The hose cabinet was missing the following required equipment: {list_any_equipment_missing_from_the_hose_cabinet}. (see attached HOSE CABINET REQUIREMENTS)

Standpipe system hose manufacture date: {what_is_the_year_of_manufacture_of_standpipe_system_hose} If some or all of the fire hoses are over 10 years old, you should be aware that manufacturers recommend replacement after 10 years.

A bound logbook is required to keep records of inspection, maintenance, and testing of Sprinkler and Standpipe Systems. Logbooks have to be replaced every calendar year. An employee of the building is supposed to hold a S-12 and S-13 (Sprinkler and Standpipe) certificate.

Fire extinguishers were not serviced by a Fire Department certified extinguisher company since {list_the_date_of_the_last_annual_extinguisher_inspection}. Fire extinguishers must serviced once every twelve months.
Fire extinguisher monthly inspection records was missing the name and certificate of fitness number of the person from certified extinguisher company the who serviced the extinguisher.

The company that services the fire extinguisher ({indicate_the_company_completing_annual_extinguisher_inspection}) was not on the Fire Department’s approved list {what_is_the_date_of_the_fdny_approved_list}. See below: Use this link to navigate to the list of approved Fire extinguisher servicing companies http://www1.nyc.gov/site/fdny/business/all-certifications/all-certifications.page Under "All Certifications" select "Get Portable Fire Extinguisher Recognition Certificate" Scroll down to "Approved Certifications" and select "List of Approved Portable Fire Extinguishing Servicing Companies"

Records of fire extinguisher monthly inspection by a building service employee were not being maintained. Records of monthly inspections must be maintained on:
  1. a tag or label attached to the extinguisher,
  2. an inspection checklist maintained on file.
  3. an electronic system (e.g. bar coding) that provides a permanent record.

No violations were found. The last annual inspection of the extinguishers was on {list_the_date_of_the_last_annual_extinguisher_inspection}. Be certain to schedule an inspection within 12 months of that date.
Fire Pump valves must be locked or electronically monitored.
There was no diagram of the fire pump system in the pump room.
There was no sign stating where the key to the locked O. S. and Y. valves is stored.
There was no sign stating the location of the standpipe hose.

There is no record of the fire pump test. Diesel fire pumps must be tested weekly and Electric fire pumps must be tested monthly. A test of fire pump assemblies shall be conducted without flowing water and shall be conducted by starting the pump automatically. An electric pump shall run a minimum of 10 minutes and diesel pump shall run a minimum of 30 minutes.

The fire pump test must be performed by an Engineer (Refrigeration Operating Engineer (Q-01 and Q-99), NYC High Pressure Operating Engineer, NYS High Pressure Operating Engineer with S-12 C of F {For employees of a single or multiple properties under common ownership employed by the same building owner/management company), an MFSPC (Master Fire Suppression Piping Contractor License with S-12 C of F) or MP (Master Plumber License (MP) with S-12 C of F.)
Records of inspections, testing and maintenance were not maintained in an approved Logbook.
Records of inspections, testing and maintenance were not maintained.
An impairment coordinator is not designated in the logbook.
Sprinkler heads need to be kept unobstructed and free of paint or dirt.
The fireproof self-closing doors to the garage were missing or inoperable.
The fireproof self-closing doors to the garage are operational.
Exit paths and doors were found to be blocked by stored vehicles.
The required mechanical fixed ventilation system was missing or inoperable.
Accumulations of rubbish were found in the garage.
Required extinguishers or pails of sand were missing.

Exit signs were missing. NYC Building Code 27-383: The location of every exit on every floor shall be clearly indicated by exit signs. Such signs shall be placed at an angle with the exit opening if such placement is required for the signs to serve their purpose. In long corridors, in open floor areas, and in all other situations where the location of the exit may not be readily visible or understood, directional signs shall be provided to serve as guides from all portions of the corridor or floor.

Fire stopping was found to be missing or insufficient in the following areas: Garage: {indicate_those_areas_in_the_garage_which_are_not_properly_fire_stopped} All penetrations must be sealed to achieve original fire rating or better. FIRE-RESISTANCE-RATED CONSTRUCTION 703.1 Maintenance: The required fire-resistance rating of fire-resistance-rated construction (including walls, fire stops, shaft enclosures, partitions and floors) shall be maintained. Such elements shall be properly repaired, restored or replaced when damaged, altered, breached or penetrated. Openings made therein for the passage of pipes, electrical conduit, wires, ducts, air transfer openings, and holes made for any reason shall be protected with approved methods capable of resisting the passage of smoke and fire. Openings through fire-resistance-rated assemblies shall be protected by self-closing or automatic-closing doors of approved construction meeting the fire protection requirements for the assembly.

The notice to the occupants concerning the installation of smoke detectors was not posted. Post a notice in a form approved by the Commissioner of the Department of Housing Preservation and Development ("HPD" or "the Department") in a common area of a Class A multiple dwelling, readily visible and preferably in the area of the inspection certificate informing the occupants of such building that: (1) the owner is required by law to install one or more approved and operational smoke alarm in each dwelling unit in the building within 15 feet of the primary entrance to each room lawfully used for sleeping purposes; (2) each occupant is responsible for the maintenance and repair of such alarms and for replacing any or all such alarms that are stolen, removed, missing, or rendered inoperable during the occupancy of such dwelling unit; and (3) the occupant of a dwelling unit in which a smoke alarm is newly installed or in which a smoke alarm is installed by the owner as a result of such occupant's failure to maintain such alarm or where such alarm has been lost or damaged by such occupant, shall reimburse the owner in the amount of $25.00 per device for the cost of such work, and such occupant shall have one year from the date of installation to make such reimbursement. (4) An owner may choose to post a single notice that complies with this provision as well as the provisions of 28 RCNY 12-01(b). (5) The notice required by this subdivision shall conform with the following requirements: (i) the notice shall have letters not less than three-sixteenths of an inch in height; (ii) the lettering of the notice shall be of bold type and shall be properly spaced to provide good legibility and the background shall be of contrasting colors; (iii) the notice shall be durable and shall be substantially secured to the common area where posted; (iv) the notice shall be of metal, plastic, or decal; and (v) lighting shall be sufficient to make the notice easily legible; and (vi) A sample of an approved notice is attached and made part of these rules. Sample Form for Notices for CO Alarms attached An owner may also choose to post a combined notice that incorporates and complies with the requirements for posting about Gas Leaks, Carbon Monoxide Detectors and Smoke Detectors.

The notice to the occupants concerning the installation of CO detectors was not posted. Post a notice in a form approved by the Commissioner of the Department of Housing Preservation and Development ("HPD" or "the Department") in a common area of a Class A multiple dwelling, readily visible and preferably in the area of the inspection certificate informing the occupants of such building that: (1) the owner is required by law to install one or more approved and operational CO alarm in each dwelling unit in the building within 15 feet of the primary entrance to each room lawfully used for sleeping purposes; (2) each occupant is responsible for the maintenance and repair of such alarms and for replacing any or all such alarms that are stolen, removed, missing, or rendered inoperable during the occupancy of such dwelling unit; and (3) the occupant of a dwelling unit in which a smoke alarm is newly installed or in which a CO alarm is installed by the owner as a result of such occupant's failure to maintain such alarm or where such alarm has been lost or damaged by such occupant, shall reimburse the owner in the amount of $25.00 per device for the cost of such work, and such occupant shall have one year from the date of installation to make such reimbursement. (4) An owner may choose to post a single notice that complies with this provision as well as the provisions of 28 RCNY 12-01(b). (5) The notice required by this subdivision shall conform with the following requirements: (i) the notice shall have letters not less than three-sixteenths of an inch in height; (ii) the lettering of the notice shall be of bold type and shall be properly spaced to provide good legibility and the background shall be of contrasting colors; (iii) the notice shall be durable and shall be substantially secured to the common area where posted; (iv) the notice shall be of metal, plastic, or decal; and (v) lighting shall be sufficient to make the notice easily legible; and (vi) A sample of an approved notice is attached and made part of these rules. Sample Form for Notices for CO Alarms attached An owner may also choose to post a combined notice that incorporates and complies with the requirements for posting about Gas Leaks, Carbon Monoxide Detectors and Smoke Detectors.

The notice to the occupants concerning the installation of smoke detectors and CO detectors was not posted. Post a notice in a form approved by the Commissioner of the Department of Housing Preservation and Development ("HPD" or "the Department") in a common area of a Class A multiple dwelling, readily visible and preferably in the area of the inspection certificate informing the occupants of such building that: (1) the owner is required by law to install one or more approved and operational smoke alarm and CO alarm in each dwelling unit in the building within 15 feet of the primary entrance to each room lawfully used for sleeping purposes; (2) each occupant is responsible for the maintenance and repair of such alarms and for replacing any or all such alarms that are stolen, removed, missing, or rendered inoperable during the occupancy of such dwelling unit; and (3) the occupant of a dwelling unit in which a smoke alarm is newly installed or in which a CO alarm is installed by the owner as a result of such occupant's failure to maintain such alarm or where such alarm has been lost or damaged by such occupant, shall reimburse the owner in the amount of $25.00 per device for the cost of such work, and such occupant shall have one year from the date of installation to make such reimbursement. (4) An owner may choose to post a single notice that complies with this provision as well as the provisions of 28 RCNY 12-01(b). (5) The notice required by this subdivision shall conform with the following requirements: (i) the notice shall have letters not less than three-sixteenths of an inch in height; (ii) the lettering of the notice shall be of bold type and shall be properly spaced to provide good legibility and the background shall be of contrasting colors; (iii) the notice shall be durable and shall be substantially secured to the common area where posted; (iv) the notice shall be of metal, plastic, or decal; and (v) Lighting shall be sufficient to make the notice easily legible; and (vi) A sample of an approved notice is attached and made part of these rules. Sample Notices - Smoke Alarms and Form for Notices for CO Alarms attached An owner may also choose to post a combined notice that incorporates and complies with the requirements for posting about Gas Leaks, Carbon Monoxide Detectors and Smoke Detectors.

There was no superintendent's sign posted. The sign must have the title, name of superintendent, address (including apartment number) and telephone number. The sign must have at least 3/16" lettering and 1/4" border around the lettering. The sign must be made out of metal or plastic unless it is made out of cardboard with a frame with clear glass or plastic cover encasing it.
The required "No Smoking" sign was not posted in the common area (lobby).

The Housing Information Guide notice was not posted. The Housing Information Guide for tenants and owners was not posted in a conspicuous place within view of the area in the multiple dwelling to which mail is delivered. (see attached notice HOUSING INFORMATION GUIDE FOR TENANTS AND OWNERS).

The building's certificate of occupancy was not posted. The certificate of occupancy should be placed in a metal or plastic frame that has a transparent covering. The certificate of occupancy must be posted in the building's main entrance hall or lobby. If the building has a superintendent the certificate of occupancy can be posted in the entrance hall of the resident superintendent's apartment or entrance to the building manager's office.

This building has a Fire Alarm or related system and requires a building employee to have an S-95 Certificate of Fitness (Supervision of Fire Alarm and other Related Systems). Additionally, a Fire Alarm Log Book must be maintained and kept up to date.
